Description: Terracotta figure of Eros. Eros standing, his left leg advanced and his body twisted to his left. He has curly hair with a central braid, and wears a garland round his neck. In his right hand he holds up a folding mirror, open to show the circular mirror and its case, and has a casket in the crook of his left arm. There is only summary treatment at the back, although the hair is well indicated; a splodge of clay near the small of the back is presumably fortuitous, although it resembles the tail of a satyr. There is no plinth, but remains of plaster over the feet may indicate that it was set into a separate stand. Hollow; two-piece mould. Orange-brown Nile silt, with traces of an overall white dressing.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Comparandum. Close: Pagenstecher 1923: 82, fig. 89.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3361)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
